p: Poly(ethylene-co-vinylacetate) (EVA) films are commonly used as food packaging in refrigerated items. EVA is composed of copolymerized PE and PVA, which has a low vapor permeability [ 29]. EVA films are widely used in food packaging applications because of their flexibility, heat sealability, high adhesivity, nontoxicity, good clarity and stretch properties [ 30, 31]. With these characteristics, EVA and EVA based composites have been widely explored.
